text: Cambridge University Press is part of
the University of Cambridge the press
was founded in 1534 with the issue of
letters patent by King Henry the 8th to
print all manner of books our mission is
to unlock people's potential with the
best learning and research solutions we
are structured around three global
publishing groups for education English
language teaching and academic we have
over 50 offices worldwide employing over
2,500 people and we are providing
solutions to students researchers
academics and institutions all over the
world our websites and digital platforms
were already running on Amazon Web
Services but we kept a very open mind
when considering all our options for
internal applications we've used AWS
professional services to support our si
P migration to AWS this is a
mission-critical work load for the press
and it was very important that we got
this right we successfully moved to the
cloud over a single weekend and
immediately encountered improved
performance we also solicited user
feedback from our users around the world
who were all impressed by the increased
performance we've realized many benefits
from our move to AWS cloud on the cost
front our infrastructure depreciation
and operating cost bill has been reduced
by over 20% and even more in some areas
we no longer have to put any effort into
data center infrastructure support and
manual activities such as handling
backup tapes is just going away we've
had architectural guidance from AWS
solution architects and we make use of
the tools that AWS provides to ensure
that we're more secure running on AWS
than we would have been with our
internal data centers we have several
workloads that periodically have huge
numbers of transactions and then have
quiet periods technically we're now able
to scale up as needed
commercially we're able to scale down
afterwards and save on running costs
going all-in with AWS is about three
things commercially it makes sense we're
reducing our costs technically it makes
sense we're increasing our systems
reliability availability and performance
and thirdly the excellent support we've
received from Amazon Web Services since
day one is amongst the best that I've
experienced in 30 years working in
technology
